dmca.title: [EV1-C1595654C] Re: Copyright infrigement
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern: Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not substantially comply with the required notification elements of the Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA"). Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your claim. Please visit our web site at www.ev1servers.net/About/dmca.aspx Legal Response Team -----Original Message----- From: abuse@ev1.net [mailto:abuse@ev1.net] Posted At: Monday, October 30, 2006 8:33 AM Posted To: DMCA Houston Conversation: [EV1-C1595654C] Re: Copyright infrigement Subject: [EV1-C1595654C] Re: Copyright infrigement ==== Forwarded Ticket ==== 1. Re: Copyright infrigement Added by system at Monday, Oct 30 2006 01:29 pm X-MailFrom: sweetney@gmail.com X-RcptTo: abacus@abacus.ev1servers.net Received: from [172.16.220.212] by [216.12.192.78] (abacus) for ; Mon Oct 30 14:31:43 2006 Received: from Exchanger.ev1servers.net ([207.218.222.101]) by MAILCORE.THEPLANET.COM with Microsoft SMTPSVC(6.0.3790.1830); Mon, 30 Oct 2006 14:28:29 -0600 Received: from mailin.ev1servers.net ([207.218.222.124]) by Exchanger.ev1servers.net with Microsoft SMTPSVC(6.0.3790.1830); Mon, 30 Oct 2006 14:28:28 -0600 X-ASG-Debug-ID: 1162240103-637-446-0 X-Barracuda-URL: http://207.218.222.124:8000/cgi-bin/mark.cgi X-ASG-Recipient-Whitelist: abuse@ev1servers.net Received: from wr-out-0506.google.com (wr-out-0506.google.com [64.233.184.227]) by mailin.ev1servers.net (Spam Firewall) with ESMTP id 416AD1A861 for ; Mon, 30 Oct 2006 14:28:28 -0600 (CST) Received: by wr-out-0506.google.com with SMTP id i5so353711wra for ; Mon, 30 Oct 2006 12:28:12 -0800 (PST) DomainKey-Signature: a=rsa-sha1; q=dns; c=nofws; s=beta; d=gmail.com; h=received:mime-version:in-reply-to:references:content-type:message-id:from:subject:date:to:x-mailer; b=p/sGs5uwudkJSuZ/554lhEoPgYakLiOX7SODn2vcB5YTS1KgAj4PMAiT5aMjc17QV+JR19rI9csGqtpW2DUn0yb11ldaR0O63jVXE7+a/l5SMBAdNyxwPtRYl9beAIDaNzLam8ooc35zW8ohTEXRcYlPLDTid/8sLGnRAKrc2DQ= Received: by 10.65.159.3 with SMTP id l3mr5395083qbo; Mon, 30 Oct 2006 12:28:12 -0800 (PST) Received: from ?10.0.1.3? ( [70.16.5.207]) by mx.google.com with ESMTP id p4sm5896927qba.2006.10.30.12.28.10; Mon, 30 Oct 2006 12:28:11 -0800 (PST) Mime-Version: 1.0 (Apple Message framework v752.2) In-Reply-To: References: Content-Type: multipart/alternative; boundary=Apple-Mail-22--750703503 Message-Id: <07A4BC56-D461-48BB-943C-31BA30C8DFD6@gmail.com> From: sweetney X-ASG-Orig-Subj: Re: Copyright infrigement Subject: Re: Copyright infrigement Date: Mon, 30 Oct 2006 15:28:10 -0500 To: abuse@ev1servers.net X-Mailer: Apple Mail (2.752.2) X-Virus-Scanned: by Barracuda Spam Firewall at ev1servers.net X-Barracuda-Spam-Score: 0.00 X-Barracuda-Spam-Status: No, SCORE=0.00 using global scores of TAG_LEVEL=4.0 QUARANTINE_LEVEL=1000.0 KILL_LEVEL=8.0 WHITELISTED Return-Path: sweetney@gmail.com X-OriginalArrivalTime: 30 Oct 2006 20:28:28.0493 (UTC) FILETIME=[F55937D0:01C6FC61] (multipart/alternative) MIME element (text/plain) Sir/Madam: I reported the following to you two days ago, and have not received any word from you regarding this very important, pressing legal matter. Please get in touch as soon as possible. Thank you. Tracey Gaughran-Perez On Oct 28, 2006, at 9:01 PM, sweetney wrote: > To Whom It May Concern: > > One of your customers -- a Matt Salandna of Apis Networks in > Linlburn, GA -- is using your data storage services to aid and abet > copyright violations and harassment on a site he hosts: > violentacres.com. This site, which Mr. Salandna has refused to take > down despite numerous written pleas from numerous wronged > individuals, harbors illegally obtained copyrighted images of > children, which the site owner has defaced and republished on the > site for the sole purpose of upsetting harassing the parents of > these children. Myself and others have informed Mr. Salandna over > the course of the past several days of the copyright violations of > the site in question, and requested that they be removed, but he > has vehemently refused to do so. And so it is that I write to you, > since it is your company that is storing the illegally obtained and > published material on your servers. > > How you proceed in getting the material removed from your servers > is entirely up to you, but since you are housing this > misappropriated material I do need to inform you of these > violations and the need for immediate action to remedy this very > serious situation. > > Please feel free to contact me for further information if > necessary. I look forward to your quick and decisive response. > > Thank you, > Tracey Gaughran-Perez > > ................................... > http://sweetney.com > sweetney@sweetney.com > MIME element (text/html)
Sir/Madam: I reported the following to you two days ago, and have not received any word from you regarding this very important, pressing legal matter. Please get in touch as soon as possible.

Thank you.
Tracey Gaughran-Perez


On Oct 28, 2006, at 9:01 PM, sweetney wrote:

To Whom It May Concern:
